main event: Two civilian observers reported seeing a large, round object with three triangular lights in the sky over Wichita, Kansas on August 23, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as a large sphere with three triangular lights, giving it an overall dull orange color.
The object was estimated to be about the size of a golf ball held at arm's length.
The object remained stationary for a few seconds, then accelerated rapidly and disappeared from sight.
The observers, an aeronautical engineer and a civilian, could not judge the speed or altitude of the object.
The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes.
sighted object: a large, round object with three triangular lights
witnesses: two civilian observers, including an aeronautical engineer
